result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel W Vance was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Misdemeanor)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Upon successful completion of all terms and conditions of probation, the Court will authorize expungement under 973.015.

miscConds.notes: Pay victim witness surcharge, DNA surcharge and all costs, assessments and surcharges.  Failure to pay all will result in entry of a civil judgment.
Mental health assessment and evaluation.  Follow up treatment.  Take prescribed medications.

No futher violations of the law.
No unsupervised contact with the victim.

Follow all rules of probation.
Anger management sessions.
Other counseling needs to be determined.
AODA assessment and any treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel W Vance

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Invoice dated: 05-14-2014
Invoice forwarded to A/P on 06-03-2014 in the amount of $625.00 to Dr. Pankiewicz for services on 03/02, 03/03, 03/17, 03/19, 03/20/2014. 
COPY IN FILE. sdg

Defendant Samuel W Vance in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by state, defense.  Defendant does not make a statement.
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction; credit for 5 days served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 24 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-Follow all rules of probation.
-No further violations of the law.
-AODA assessment and any treatment.
-Mental health assessment and evaluation and follow up treatment.
-Take prescribed medications.
-Anger management sessions.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Random urine screens.
-No unsupervised contact with the victim.
-Other counseling needs to be determined.
-Perform 25 HOURS of community service at a non-profit agency.
-Pay victim witness surcharge, DNA surcharge and all costs, assessments and surcharges.
FAILURE TO PAY ALL COSTS ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES WILL RESULT IN ENTRY OF CIVIL JUDGMENT.
Upon successful completion of all terms and conditions of probation the Court will authorize expungement under 973.015.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

To the amended charge:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Case is adjourned to 5-12-2014 at 8:15 for sentencing.

Defendant Samuel W Vance in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to BATTERY WHILE ARMED, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1) and 939.63(1)(a), a Class A misdemeanor.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Samuel W Vance in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Report of Dr. Pankiewicz is reviewed by all parties.  Report does not support a special plea.  Defense is in agreement and does not challenge the report.
Case is adjourned to 4-24-2014 at 8:15 for plea/sentencing.
Report of Dr. Pankiewicz dated 3-24-2014 received and filed.

Defendant Samuel W Vance in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.  The Court will appoint Dr. Pankiewicz to conduct exam of the defendant as to special plea.
Case is adjourned to 3-27-2014 at 8:15 for return of report.  Atty Devitt is to take defendant to Forensic Unit immediately after court to schedule appointment for exam.
Order for exam signed and filed.
Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 1/27/14.

Defendant Samuel W Vance in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Arraignment scheduled for February 25, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ZJE

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.   Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or cash bail.

Defendant Samuel W Vance in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Defendant Samuel W Vance in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
*
On review of the complaint and on court's motion complaint is amended, Court strikes the penalty enhancer 939.63(1)(a).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
